page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The population of the area is about 150. It is, by Devon village standards, a good mixture of age and occupation. Farming is the main employer, but several men work in the building trades and the Combe House Hotel has, of course, its staff. Some of the old country trades remain including those of baker, cabinet-maker and game-keeper. Gittisham Hill House, in the North-East corner of the Block, is a home for the elderly. When the craft centre has been finished, more employment will be available. Combe Farm includes a stud of breeding Arab ponies. Very few people work outside the immediate locality. The village is not a dormitory, but has an existence in its own right.
